alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 1:18PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, Riverside. Rouse Ridge east side of Fairview burn scar west of Idyllwild. * WHEN...Until 315 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Burn scar mud flows in remote areas of Rouse Ridge. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 118 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Rouse Ridge Fairview burn scar is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hwy 243 Between Banning And Idyllwild, Idyllwild-Pine Cove, Hemet, San Jacinto, Valle Vista, Hwy 74 Between Hemet And Mountain Center, East Hemet and Saboba Indian Reservation. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
